official-title.#text:
To require the Director of the Federal Bureau of
		  Investigation to report and obtain court approval for broad telephony metadata
		  collection searches, and for other purposes.

committee-name.#tail:
, for a period to be subsequently determined by the
			 Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the
			 jurisdiction of the committee concerned

cosponsor.#tail:
)
			 introduced the following bill; which was referred to the
cosponsor.#text: Mr. Danny K. Davis of Illinois

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is
			 amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 501 of the
			 Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act of 1978

header.#text:
Limits on
			 Searching Telephony Metadata in the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act of
			 1978

Court Approval
				for Searching Telephony Metadata

text.#text:
No person may search telephony metadata
				acquired pursuant to a production order under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
makes an application to a judge of the
				court established by
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Director of
				the Federal Bureau of Investigation

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that includes a statement of facts showing
				that there is a reasonable, articulable suspicion that the basis of the search
				is material and specifically relevant to an authorized investigation;
				and

text.#text:
the judge finds
				that there is a reasonable, articulable suspicion that the basis of the search
				is material and specifically relevant to an authorized investigation and enters
				an order authorizing such search.

term.#tail: means an order to produce any tangible thing under this section.

means communications routing information,
				including session identifying information, an original or terminating telephone
				number, an International Mobile Subscriber Identity, an International Mobile
				Station Equipment Identity, a trunk identifier, a telephone calling card
				number, and the time or duration of a
				call.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the
			 end the following new subsection:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 502 of the Foreign Intelligence
			 Surveillance Act of 1978

header.#text:
Congressional
			 Oversight for Production Orders of Telephony Metadata in the Foreign
			 Intelligence Surveillance Act of 1978

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Director of the Federal Bureau of
				Investigation

Permanent Select Committee on
				Intelligence of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
a report describing each search made during the
				preceding month of telephony metadata pursuant to an order under

Select Committee on
				Intelligence of the Senate
